main event: A witness reported seeing a bright, round, white light in the sky that seemed to be moving rapidly and changing direction before disappearing in Lynchburg, Virginia on April 5, 1958.
interesting points: The witness, Private John Doe of the U.S. Army, immediately reported his observation to military authorities.
Private Doe is considered a reliable observer with no known history of mental illness or tendency toward imaginary sightings.
No explanation for the observed object has been found at the time of the report, and the case remains under investigation.
The witness observed the object from his apartment window in Lynchburg, Virginia.
The object appeared to change direction several times before disappearing.
